intro: Youngia striata, commonly known as the narrow-leafed hawkweed, is a flowering plant native to the temperate regions of Asia and North America. It is a herbaceous perennial that typically grows to a height of about 30 to 60 centimeters. The plant features basal leaves that are linear and often covered with fine hairs, while its stems are usually hairless and somewhat woody at the base. Its flowers are small, yellow, and arranged in a dense cluster at the top of the stem, resembling a head of hawkweed. Youngia striata is often found in disturbed soils and can be invasive in certain regions due to its rapid growth and ability to spread through rhizomes.
